channel.title: Read and try to help!
channel.description: Hello everyone. A slight problem here, not much of a problem but I need a bit of help. The picture will be placed in the attachment. I would like to know how to remove the title Runescape at the top, the fire and the log in box to blend in with my background. Thanks! :D

item.title: Read and try to help!
item.dc:creator: @Fox0wnage Fox0wnage
item.description:
@Fox0wnage wrote:

I downloaded the suite from nuke-net.
Now, I try to upload my cache.
So I click my client location and press okay it gives me this error
“An error occured whilst loading cache:
java.io.IOException: Unable to locate cache data file!”

It is quite obvious to me, that apparently I am not opening the correct thing.
If someone could tell me where to find the cache I would be very grateful.
Yes I know i’m new to this.

Read full topic

item.title: Read and try to help!
item.dc:creator: @Vice117 Vice117
item.description:
@Vice117 wrote:

I remember downloading a client and looking through all the files a while ago… and I found a folder which contained the background image for the login screen. Could you just change that and the client would load the new picture for the login screen, or is changing the background alot more complicated???

Read full topic

item.title: Read and try to help!
item.dc:creator: @MasterofPK MasterofPK
item.description:
@MasterofPK wrote:

I swear i made a post on this. Anyway…

You need the RS cache editing suite, once it is open and you have loaded your cache.

Click veiw/edit image archives, select Title, the click on the RS logo and press the little - button it should dissapear. Now just click the save archive button, close and compile.

Read full topic

item.title: Read and try to help!

There are no tutorials on it, I really need some help here

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

ooo, yar its in the cache as he said, try going to client hacking or w.e for 317s and look for a tut i believe packing and unpacking client cache or somethin… u basically just have to remove the statement in your cache, either that or i believe its in sub30_2_1_ or something.

Read full topic
